choices.B: Antivirus signatures are downloaded locally on FortiGate.
choices.C: FortiGate downloads IPS updates using UDP port 53 or 8888.

choices.A: The web filtering database is downloaded locally on FortiGate.

discussion.content:
Correct answer is A&D
B is a bogus response, checking the last packet is a bit too late to establish a connection.
Whoever provided these answers failed this exam. Should also be "First" instead of "Trust"

Question should be "First" not "Trust"
 • For any session, FortiGate performs a routing table lookup twice:
 ○ For the first packet sent by the originator
 ○ For the first reply packet coming from the responder
https://kb.fortinet.com/kb/documentLink.do?externalID=FD50169

route lookup is performed twice: 
- on the FIRST packet sent by the originator
- on the FIRST reply packet from the responder
=> FIRST should be the word used instead of "TRUST" in this question
Answer is A&d
Bonne Réponse : A et D
FortiGate_Infrastructure_6.2_Study_Guide-Online (page 8). The correct answers are A and D. However, It should be "First packet", instead of "Trust packet".
for sure A&D
A & D i think

choices.D: Lookup is done on the trust reply packet from the responder
choices.B: Lookup is done on the last packet sent from the responder
choices.C: Lookup is done on every packet, regardless of direction
choices.A: Lookup is done on the trust packet from the session originator

questions.question_text: Which of the following statements correctly describes FortiGates route lookup behavior when searching for a suitable gateway? (Choose two)

discussion.content: B. FortiGate will use the port1 route as the primary candidate. It has better priority
B is correct i think

choices.C: FortiGate will route twice as much traffic to the port2 route
choices.A: FortiGate will load balance all traffic across both routes.
choices.D: FortiGate will only actuate the port1 route in the routing table
choices.B: FortiGate will use the port1 route as the primary candidate.
